The New York Yankees have the distinction of being the only team in MLB to LOSE a 7 game Championship series after being ahead 3-0!

 I've liked only one Yankee in my whole life...and she was naked at the time! :)

post_info.post_title: The Yankees have broken another record!

Waxy

I know I'm rejoicing!
 
 The despised Yankees are now holders of one of the most dubious records in baseball, and my beloved Red Sox have the distinction of handing them that record.
 
 How sweet it is.
 
 Waxy
jim's trucking
Who could possibly not want the Sox to go all the way now? Even though Kerry is from Massachusetts and Bush is from Texas, I'll put the politics aside and pull for the Bostonians!
Big Orn

Who could possibly not want the Sox to go all the way now? Even though Kerry is from Massachusetts and Bush is from Texas, I'll put the politics aside and pull for the Bostonians!

 I don't know which way to go. I want the Sox, but then, shoot, here's our own team in it....what to do, what to do. emoticon_cry 
 
 I can't wait to see it - guess I'll be rooting for both. :xbanghead
jim's trucking
I just hope it goes to the seventh game...the concessions people just love it when that happens.
Famous Amos

Who could possibly not want the Sox to go all the way now? Even though Kerry is from Massachusetts and Bush is from Texas, I'll put the politics aside and pull for the Bostonians!

 
 
 I don't. I love the Cardinals. Before the season started, everyone had predicted St. Louis to finish 3rd, 4th, or even 5th in their own division with no shot whatsoever of any playoff run. They all somehow knew that Chicago and Houston would run away with the Divison and Wildcard. Little did they know, St. Louis would have the best offense in the majors with Walker, Pujols, Rolen, and Edmonds, one of the best defenses (Walker, Edmonds, Rolen, Renteria, and Matheney are all gold-glovers), and a better than expected pitching staff. I think St. Louis is one of the biggest underdogs from this season. Everyone knew Boston would make the playoffs. Nobody thought St. Louis would. After tonight's game and another St. Louis win, we will see who comes out on top in the World Series. My bets go to the Cardinals.
jim's trucking

Naturally, I was assuming Houston would win tonight. However, should the Cards pull out a victory, I will still have to pull for the yankees over the rebels, even though I come from the Deep South...God's country!
Famous Amos

Naturally, I was assuming Houston would win tonight. However, should the Cards pull out a victory, I will still have to pull for the yankees over the rebels, even though I come from the Deep South...God's country!

 
 
 I think it will be hard for the Astros to pull off another victory tonight. Their bullpen is shot...Lidge has thrown in the last 5 games, some of them 2 and 3 innings each. He threw 3 last night. Wheeler also threw 2 or 3 last night. Other than that, their bullpen is basically garbage. Unless Clemens can somehow throw 9 innings and shut down the Cardinals, I find it hard for them to win. The St. Louis bullpen is still rather fresh, minus Isringhausen. Ray King, Cal Eldred, and Danny Haren didn't throw at all last night. Julian Tavarez has only thrown 2 innings in the last 3 games.
 
 It is pretty apparent that Game 7 will come down to the bullpen, unless the starters can basically throw a shutout or limit the other team to 1 or 2 runs, which is highly unlikely. I am calling at least 1 homerun for Pujols tonight.
 
 My prediction for the World Series: Cardinals over Red Sox in 6 games

 Yep, the Cards are just a better team. They've got 4 of the best hitters in baseball (Rolen, Pujols, Edmonds, Walker). They've got one of the best offensive and defensive catchers in the league. They have speed in Womack, Sanders, and Renteria. The one drawback is the pitching. They've got Morris and Suppan, but other than Isringhousen (sp?) their bullpen isn't all that great for a world series team. I'd still take the Cardinlas though. The Red Sox just don't have what it takes.

 The Red Sox have shown they do have what it takes. Most good-hitting teams (such as the Cardinals) will beat you if you make one single mistake as a pitcher. The Red Sox have done more than that. Variteck's triple last night was right where the pitcher wanted it and he still knocked the :xcensored out of it. Ortiz has done the same thing with a few home runs. But now they go to St. Louis for 3 games and the Cards have done well at home beating Houston 2 in a row there one of them against Clemens. The problem is, if they want a WS ring, they'll have to take at least one at Fenway. They've got to face Pedro Martinez tommorrow, so we'll see what they can do.
 
 But at least this year if they lose, I really wouldn't mind the Red Sox winning. If it were the Yankees playing the Cardinals, that would be a different story...
jim's trucking
